basic_info.description: I'm Drew Stroede, a software developer based in Houston, Texas. With a unique background in college athletics and a Master's Degree in Business Administration, I bring a blend of discipline and business acumen to the tech world. My career has taken me from optimizing human performance to sales and team building. But my true passion lies in web development. I'm on a mission to leverage technology to help individuals sharpen their skills, build productive habits, and reach levels of excellence they've never achieved before. I believe the web is a powerful tool for personal and professional growth. In my portfolio, you'll find a showcase of my projects and collaborations, embodying my commitment to making a positive impact through technology. Beyond my professional life, I thrive on bringing people together and fostering meaningful conversations. Let's connect and explore how we can collaborate to create something extraordinary. Together, we can make a difference in the world of technology and beyond.

projects.title: Gallery of horns
projects.description: Let me introduce you to my latest project, the 'Gallery of Horns'. It's my first dive into React and Bootstrap. The application fetches cards dynamically from a data.json file, providing users with the opportunity to click on each card for additional creature details. Moreover, it includes a feature that enables users to filter animals based on the number of horns they possess. To add a touch of personalization, the app also allows users to mark their favorite creatures.

projects.title: Pair Panic
projects.description: Pair Panic was a collaborative effort during our final project at Code Fellows. Despite the constraints of using basic HTML, CSS, and JavaScript, we successfully crafted a highly responsive design. The website showcases a captivating matching card game that highlights the pets of each group member. Notably, the game also has the capability to record scores from users' computers.

projects.title: Salmon Cookies
projects.description: I created this website to enhance my understanding of DOM manipulations and have some fun experimenting with CSS. As you browse through this project, you will notice that the code is well-organized, and there is a responsive 'Add Location' chart that lets you generate your own statistics for the fictional Salmon Cookie store.
